item.title: Jim add a quote by William O. Douglas
item.description:
"Restriction of free thought and free speech is the most dangerous of all subversions. It is the one un-American act that could most easily defeat us."
[<i>The One Un-American Act</i>, Speech to the Author's Guild Council in New York, on receiving the 1951 Lauterbach Award (December 3, 1952)]" -- William O. Douglas

item.title: Jim add a quote by William O. Douglas
item.description:
"The right to be let alone is indeed the beginning of all freedom."
[<i>Public Utilities Commission v. Pollak</i>, 343 U.S. 451, 467 (1952) (dissenting)]" -- William O. Douglas

item.title: Jim add a quote by Adelaide Hoodless
item.description: "Educate a boy, and you educate an individual. Educate a girl, and you educate a community." -- Adelaide Hoodless

item.title: Jim add a quote by Greg Mortenson
item.description: "You can hand out condoms, drop bombs, build roads, or put in electricity, but until the girls are educated a society won’t change." -- Greg Mortenson

item.title: Jim add a quote by Greg Mortenson
item.description: "If we try to resolve terrorism with military might and nothing else, then we will be no safer than we were before 9/11. If we truly want a legacy of peace for our children, we need to understand that this is a war that will ultimately be won with books, not with bombs." -- Greg Mortenson

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jim add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness." -- John Muir

item.title: Jim add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The mountains are calling and I must go." -- John Muir

item.title: Jim add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world." -- John Muir

item.title: Jim add a quote by John LeCarre'
item.description: "It's the sounds and smells of earlier years coming back to you. It's the sky you used to look at when you were a child. You understand ideas again. Money has no power." -- John LeCarre'

item.title: Jim add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Jim add a quote by Cory Doctorow
item.description: "Funny, for all surveillance, Osama bin Laden is still free&#151;and we're not. Guess who's winning the "war on terror?" -- Cory Doctorow

item.title: Jim add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Good writing is supposed to evoke sensation in the reader—not the fact that it is raining, but the feeling of being rained upon." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Jim add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "The writer isn't made in a vacuum. Writers are witnesses. The reason we need writers is because we need witnesses to this terrifying century." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Jim add a quote by Aaron Sorkin
item.description:
"Mrs. Landingham, does the President have free time this morning?
The President has nothing but free time, Toby. Right now he's in the residence eating Cheerios and enjoying Regis and Kathie Lee. Should I get him for you?
Sarcasm's a disturbing thing coming from a woman of your age, Mrs. Landingham.
What age would that be, Toby?
Late twenties?
Atta boy." -- Aaron Sorkin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Aaron Sorkin
item.description: "Toby Zeigler: There's literally no one in the world I don't hate right now." -- Aaron Sorkin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Aaron Sorkin
item.description: "Josh: So, Toby, it’s election night. What do you say about a country that goes out of its way to protect even those citizens that try to destroy it? Toby: God bless America." -- Aaron Sorkin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Men have called me mad; but the question is not yet settled, whether madness is or is not the loftiest intelligence– whether much that is glorious– whether all that is profound– does not spring from disease of thought– from moods of mind exalted at the expense of the general intellect." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jim add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Men will always be mad, and those who think they can cure them are the maddest of all." -- Voltaire

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Education, n. That which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Sweater</b>, n. Garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Jim add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Jim add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "We are our choices." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Jim add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Jim add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jim add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "We need never be ashamed of our tears." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jim add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "In a word, I was too cowardly to do what I knew to be right, as I had been too cowardly to avoid doing what I knew to be wrong." -- Charles Dickens
